p: The antioxidant activity assay showed that the representative SNEDDS (F1: BSO/CMCM/CrEL [15/35/50] %w/w) possess moderate antioxidant activity in both methods (DPPH scavenging and Î²-carotene bleaching assay) when they are compared with the standards (Ascorbic acid and Rutin). The result from the study shown in Table 5 suggested that thymoquinone is the main constituent of the BSO ( N. sativa seeds), which was reported to have antioxidant activity. It has retained its antioxidant activity when formulated with model drugs, SN and DN, in the current study.
